intro: Micromeria fruticosa subsp. giresunica, commonly known as the Giresun micromeria, is a shrub native to Turkey. It is characterized by its small, aromatic leaves and clusters of yellow flowers that bloom in summer. The plant thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to Mediterranean climates. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs. Its subspecies status highlights its distinct geographical and morphological traits compared to the broader species.
